C_STDEQ.name: Standard Equipment View all
C_STDEQ.disclaimer:
Standard for P100D

  • Choice of Premium Interior with any décor, including carbon fiber
  • Prevent viruses and bacteria from entering the cabin with a medical-grade HEPA air filtration system
  • Bioweapon Defense Mode blocks offensive odors, nitrogen oxides and hydrocarbon exhaust fumes from polluting cabin air with two activated carbon purification filters
  • Premium Audio Upgrade standard with custom audio specifically tuned for a Tesla’s ultra-quiet cabin
  • XM satellite radio capability when paired with Sunroof
  • Sub-Zero Weather Package included as standard featuring heated seats for every passenger, heated steering wheel, wiper blade defrosters and washer nozzle heaters
  • Optional carbon fiber spoiler
  • Phone dock included and installed

Convenience

  • Smart air suspension with GPS memory for automatically raising and lowering ride height
  • Front and rear trunks with 31.6 cubic feet of storage
  • Power liftgate
  • Keyless entry with lighted, self-presenting door handles
  • Ambient interior lighting
  • Heated front seats

Safety

  • Active safety technologies, including collision avoidance and automatic emergency braking
  • Power-folding, auto-dimming and heated side mirrors
  • Three-position dynamic LED turning lights for nighttime visibility
  • LED fog lights
  • Two LATCH child seat attachments

Technology

  • Over-the-air software updates add features and enhance performance
  • Maps and navigation with real time traffic information
  • 400 kWh of free annual Supercharger credits
  • GPS-enabled Homelink for opening and closing garage doors
  • Center console with removable dividers

Warranty

  • 8 year, infinite mile battery and drive unit warranty
  • 4 year, 50,000 mile limited warranty

C_PERF.name: Model S Performance
C_PERF.disclaimer:
PerformancePerformance acceleration ratings are based on maximum battery power mode and follow Motor Trend's test procedure of subtracting the first foot rollout time to represent drag strip performance.RangeFigures based on testing to EPA standard. Vehicle range may vary depending on the vehicle configuration, battery age and condition, driving style and operating, environmental and climate conditions.

For additional information, please see the current version of the Owner’s Manual. The Owner’s Manual may be updated and revised as new features are introduced. Please refer to your vehicle’s Owner’s Manual for the most up to date information.

C_CHG_INSTALL.name: Home Charging Installation
C_CHG_INSTALL.disclaimer: Home Charging InstallationAt this time, we can offer home charging installations in Massachusetts and Nevada only. Charging installations are invoiced separately from the price of your vehicle and payment is due upon completion of installation.

C_WT.name: Wheels
C_WT.disclaimer: WheelsThere are different advantages to the 21-inch and 19-inch wheels. For example, the 21-inch wheels generally provide increased handling whereas the 19-inch wheels wear less quickly and provide more protection from obstacles and poor road conditions.

configSetPrices.name: US 2017 AUGUST

HC01.description: Tesla will install a 240 volt outlet near your parking spot, providing up to 29 miles of range per hour of charge. Most installations cost $1,000. If your home requires electrical upgrades or other trade work to accommodate charging, additional charges may apply. You may also upgrade to a Wall Connector for a higher rate of charge.
HC01.name: Home Charging Installation
HC01.disclaimer: Payment due upon completion of installation

AU01.description:
Wrap your cabin in a pristine and powerful soundstage. This upgrade includes a larger amplifier, a subwoofer, and 11 precisely positioned speakers to faithfully reproduce sound and deliver it directly to your ears and those of your passengers. This is a custom-designed audiophile-quality system that takes best advantage of the interior and ultra-quiet motors of Model S. The result is a listening experience that is unique in the automotive world, besting much more expensive systems in head-to-head comparisons. The package includes:

  • XM satellite radio capability
  • 11 speakers with neodymium magnets including an 8" subwoofer
  • High bitrate streaming capability
AU01.name: Premium Sound
AU01.disclaimer: XM satellite radio capability requires the Sunroof

WTDS.description: Standard with Goodyear Eagle RS-A2 high performance all-season tires.
WTDS.name: 19" Grey Slipstream Wheels

WTSS.description: Standard with Continental ExtremeContact tires for high performance in both wet and dry conditions.
WTSS.name: 21" Turbine

PS01.description: Add extra privacy to the cargo area with the removable parcel shelf, which slides between the rear seats and rear window to shield belongings from view.
PS01.name: Parcel Shelf

RFFG.description: Retractable roof made of lightweight safety glass which exceeds federal safety standards and blocks both 98% of ultraviolet light and 81% of solar heat. Standard with mounting points for roof racks.
RFFG.name: Glass Roof

BP01.description: Ludicrous Speed decreases the 0-60 mph time for Model S 10% to 2.8 seconds with a quarter mile time of 10.9 seconds. Time to 155 miles per hour is now 20% faster than a standard Model S Performance.
BP01.name: Ludicrous Speed Upgrade

BC0R.description: Tesla Red four piston Brembo brake calipers.
BC0R.name: Tesla Red Brake Calipers

RFP2.description: Retractable roof made of lightweight safety glass which exceeds federal safety standards and blocks both 98% of ultraviolet light and 81% of solar heat. Standard with mounting points for roof racks.
RFP2.name: Sunroof
RFP2.disclaimer: Required for roof rack and satellite radio compatibility

SU01.description: Experience superior handling, efficiency, and ride comfort. Adjust the height of your Model S. Smart Air Suspension also utilizes the GPS of your car to recognize the location of past adjustments to suspension height and automatically updates when you revisit specific locations, such as a steep driveway.
SU01.name: Smart Air Suspension

DV4W.override_description:
• The Model S 100D provides great value, combining the longest range available with the instant acceleration of Tesla’s electric all-wheel drive.
  • 100 kWh Battery with All-Wheel Drive
  • 335 mile range (EPA)
  • 155 mph top speed
  • 4.1 sec. 0-60 mph
  • Smart Air Suspension Included

• 259 miles range (EPA)
  • 140 mph top speed
  • 4.2 seconds 0-60 mph
  • 75 kWh Battery
  • Smart Air Suspension Included

DV2W.override_description:
• 249 miles range (EPA)
  • 140 mph top speed
  • 4.3 seconds 0-60 mph
  • 75 kWh Battery
  • Smart Air Suspension Included

FG02.description: Cut through fog and illuminate obstacles on dark roads with LED fog lights that are controlled through the touchscreen. Our newly redesigned fog lights are designed to work with our LED cornering lights and headlights as a complete system.
FG02.name: Exterior Lighting Package

YF01.description: Add elegance to your center console tray with a yacht floor that matches your car's décor. Strips of rubber run lengthwise atop the trim for added grip.
YF01.name: Matching Yacht Floor

INBPW.description: White seats are stain resistant, easy to clean, and perform best of all seats during high volume test drives. Tesla Recommended.
INBPW.name: White

PX6D.name: Zero to 60 in 2.5 sec

DV4W.override_description:
• Model S P100D is the world’s fastest accelerating production car and comes standard with our best options and upgrades including Ludicrous Speed Upgrade, our best interior and the Premium Upgrades package.
  • 100 kWh Battery with Performance All-Wheel Drive
  • 315 mile range (EPA)
  • 155 mph top speed
  • 2.5 seconds 0-60 mph
  • 1.2 seconds passing speed, 45-65 mph
DV4W.override_name: The Ultimate Tesla.  Max Performance.  All Premium.

HP01.description: Designed to mimic the fluid, futuristic design of Model S, the Wall Connector is the fastest, easiest way to charge at home. The Wall Connector does not require Dual Chargers, but it will not reach its maximum 80 amp charging capability without them.
HP01.name: Wall Connector

WTSG.description: Standard with Continental ExtremeContact tires for high performance in both wet and dry conditions.
WTSG.name: 21" Turbine

COL2.description: Metallic colors (available at 7 months of production)
COL2.name: Metallic

COL3.description: Premium colors (available at 9 months of production)
COL3.name: Tesla Multi-coat

COL1.description: Solid Colors (available first 6 months of production)
COL1.name: Solid

QTPW.name: White Premium Interior
QTPW.disclaimer: Tesla Recommended, both durable and stain resistant

APF2.description:
This doubles the number of active cameras from four to eight, enabling full self-driving in almost all circumstances, at what we believe will be a probability of safety at least twice as good as the average human driver. The system is designed to be able to conduct short and long distance trips with no action required by the person in the driver’s seat. For Superchargers that have automatic charge connection enabled, you will not even need to plug in your vehicle.

All you will need to do is get in and tell your car where to go. If you don’t say anything, the car will look at your calendar and take you there as the assumed destination or just home if nothing is on the calendar. Your Tesla will figure out the optimal route, navigate urban streets (even without lane markings), manage complex intersections with traffic lights, stop signs and roundabouts, and handle densely packed freeways with cars moving at high speed. When you arrive at your destination, simply step out at the entrance and your car will enter park seek mode, automatically search for a spot and park itself. A tap on your phone summons it back to you.

Please note that Self-Driving functionality is dependent upon extensive software validation and regulatory approval, which may vary widely by jurisdiction. It is not possible to know exactly when each element of the functionality described above will be available, as this is highly dependent on local regulatory approval. Please note also that using a self-driving Tesla for car sharing and ride hailing for friends and family is fine, but doing so for revenue purposes will only be permissible on the Tesla Network, details of which will be released next year.
APF2.name: Full Self-Driving Capability

BTX6.override_disclaimer:
• 294 miles range (EPA)
  • 155 mph top speed
  • 4.2 sec. 0-60 mph

BTX5.override_disclaimer:
• 249 miles range (EPA)
  • 140 mph top speed
  • 5.5 sec. 0-60 mph

X019.description: Improve high speed stability by adding the carbon fiber spoiler to your trunk lid. Made from lightweight, cross-woven carbon fibers with a matte epoxy finish.
X019.name: Carbon Fiber Spoiler

APPB.description:
Enhanced Autopilot adds new capabilities to the Tesla Autopilot driving experience. The enhancements include going from one to four cameras for greater accuracy, redundancy, and to see fast-approaching vehicles in adjacent lanes. In addition, 12 ultrasonic sonar sensors provide 360 degree coverage around your car with almost twice the range and resolution of the prior version.

The significantly increased sensor information is processed by a computer that is over 40 times more powerful than before. Your Tesla will match speed to traffic conditions, keep within a lane, automatically change lanes without requiring driver input, transition from one freeway to another, exit the freeway when your destination is near, self-park when near a parking spot and be summoned to and from your garage. That said, Enhanced Autopilot should still be considered a driver's assistance feature with the driver responsible for remaining in control of the car at all times.

Tesla’s Enhanced Autopilot software has begun rolling out and features will continue to be introduced as validation is completed, subject to regulatory approval.
APPB.name: Enhanced Autopilot

WTAS.description: Standard with Goodyear Eagle RS-A2 high performance all-season tires.
WTAS.name: 19" Silver Slipstream Wheels

CW02.description:
Improve cold-weather comfort and convenience by adding:

  • Seat heaters throughout the cabin
  • Heated steering wheel
  • Wiper blade defrosters
  • Washer nozzle heaters
CW02.name: Subzero Weather Package

WTW4.description: Four standard 19" wheels with mounted Pirelli Winter Sottozero winter tires, size 245/45-19.
WTW4.name: 19" Winter Tire Set

WTW5.description: Four 21" wheels with mounted Pirelli Winter Sottozero winter tires, size 245/35-21. Winter wheels will be matched to your Model S.
WTW5.name: 21" Winter Tire Set

YFFC.description: Add covered storage between the front seats of your Model S. This console includes an integrated quick connection phone dock and removable dividers that allow for customized storage for drinks, wallets, sunglass, etc. The Premium Center Console replaces the yacht floor center console tray.
YFFC.name: Integrated Center Console
YFFC.disclaimer: Removing the Integrated Center Console will replace it with the Console Tray.

CH04.description: The High Amperage Charger equips Model S with 17.2 kW on onboard charging capabilities, increasing speeds up to 52 miles per hour when used with a Tesla Wall Connector installed on a 90 amp circuit breaker. Recommended for high mileage drivers and those who regularly travel off of the beaten path.
CH04.name: High Amperage Charger

PX01.description: Performance Plus adds world class handling to the incredible acceleration of Model S Performance, while also improving range. After hundreds of iterations affecting every detail of the suspension, our vehicle dynamics team was able to achieve the rare outcome of improving both performance and efficiency. In addition to upgraded dampers, bushings, stabilizer bars and tires (Michelin Pilot Sport PS2), the rear tires are 20 mm wider and staggered for improved acceleration on low grip surfaces. Range improves 6 to 12 miles over regular 21" wheels.
PX01.name: Performance Plus
PX01.disclaimer: Requires P85 or P85D, Tech Package, Smart Air Suspension, and 21" Wheels

X024.name: Performance Package

TR01.description: Carry up to 7 passengers in Model S by adding seating for two children with rear facing seats. Engineered to far exceed federal safety standards, they attach to a second frame that augments our standard bumper with high strength aluminum for the utmost protection. These comfortable seats are hand wrapped in black microfiber and fold completely flat into the floor when not in use.
TR01.name: Rear Facing Seats

LP01.description:
Add ambiance to Model S with strategically placed LED lights that illuminate without reflecting off the windshield. Interior lighting includes:
  • Door-panel ambient lights
  • Second-row footwell lights
  • Second-row puddle lights
LP01.name: Premium Interior Lighting

PI01.description:
• Prevent viruses and bacteria from entering the cabin with a medical-grade HEPA air filtration system
    Includes Bioweapon Defense Mode
  • Block offensive odors, nitrogen oxides and hydrocarbon exhaust fumes from polluting cabin air with two activated carbon purification filters
  • Custom audio system specifically tuned for a Tesla’s ultra-quiet cabin
  • XM satellite radio capability when paired with Sunroof
  • Sub-zero weather features including heated seats for every passenger, heated steering wheel, wiper blade defrosters and washer nozzle heaters
PI01.name: Premium Upgrades Package

configSetPrices.disclaimer:
Electric Vehicle IncentivesModel S qualifies for a $7,500 federal tax credit and other state sponsored tax incentives and rebates. Visit your state program’s website for information on eligibility and availability. As of March 29, 2016, eligibility for California’s rebate is based on income.
Gasoline SavingsElectric vehicles are less expensive to fuel than gasoline powered vehicles. The average person drives between 10,000 and 15,000 miles and spends between $1,300 and $1,900 on gasoline per year. In comparison, the cost of electricity to power Model S over the same distance is up to four times lower. Over the five year average length of car ownership, that's between $4,400 and $6,600 in gasoline savings.

We've assumed a fuel economy of 21 miles per gallon for a comparable gasoline powered premium sedan, for example, the 2016 Mercedes-Benz S550. We've also assumed the national average of $0.13 per kilowatt-hour for electricity, 10% charging on Tesla’s Supercharger network and $2.70 per gallon for premium gasoline over the next five years.
CalculatorThe calculator above provides information about the price of the car if you pay in cash and the estimated monthly payment if you participate in Tesla Leasing or Tesla Lending. The calculator does not include taxes or fees, which vary from state to state and in some cases, town to town.
Tesla LeasingWe’re able to offer Tesla Leasing in an increasing number of states. For states where Tesla Leasing is not available, we can help you identify other financing options. Participation in Tesla Leasing is based on a standard approval process. No security deposit required.
Tesla LendingThe monthly loan payments are based on a program for Tesla customers with Alliant Credit Union which is available in all 50 states.
